name.text: 27.1.5.3 Special Cases of Double Integrals Exercise

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Evaluate the following integral

(Note: If you are struggling to see the upper integration limit of the outer integral on your device, it is: \(\displaystyle {@aa@}\))

\(\displaystyle I=\displaystyle\int_{0}^{@aa@} \displaystyle \int_{0}^{@bb@} y\cos(x)\, \mathrm{d}y \mathrm{d}x \)

\(I=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

If your answer is not an integer, leave it in rational form e.g. 23/5.

generalfeedback.text:
The integration takes place over the rectangle shown below.

[[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [-1, {#ymax#}, {#xmax#}, -1], keepaspectratio: true, axis: true, showCopyright: false, showNavigation: false, grid: false }); // Hide tick labels and ticks on x-axis but label it board.defaultAxes.x.setAttribute({ ticks: { drawLabels: false, // hide numbers majorHeight: 0, minorHeight: 0 }, name: 'x', withLabel: true, label: { position: 'rt', offset: [1, -10] } }); // Hide tick labels and ticks on y-axis but label it board.defaultAxes.y.setAttribute({ ticks: { drawLabels: false, majorHeight: 0, minorHeight: 0 }, name: 'y', withLabel: true, label: { position: 'rt', offset: [-15, 0] } }); // points var bl = board.create('point', [0,0], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: true, showInfobox: false, size: 3, face: 'o', fillColor: 'black', strokeColor: 'black'}); var br = board.create('point', [{#float_aa#},0], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: true, showInfobox: false, size: 3, face: 'o', fillColor: 'black', strokeColor: 'black'}) var tr = board.create('point', [{#float_aa#},{#bb#}], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: true, showInfobox: false, size: 3, face: 'o', fillColor: 'black', strokeColor: 'black'}); var tl = board.create('point', [0,{#bb#}], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: true, showInfobox: false, size: 3, face: 'o', fillColor: 'black', strokeColor: 'black'}); var rectangle = board.create('polygon', [bl, br, tr, tl],{name:"Rectangle",withLabel:false, color: 'white'}); // Set all edges (borders) to dark blue rectangle.borders.forEach(line => { line.setAttribute({strokeColor: 'darkblue'}); }); // Labels for points on left (x=0), show numeric coords [bl, tl].forEach(pt => { board.create('text', [ () => pt.X() + 0.15, () => pt.Y() + 0.15, () => `(${Math.round(pt.X())}, ${Math.round(pt.Y())})` ], {fontSize: 12, fixed: true, highlight: false}); }); // Labels for points on right (x = aa), show symbolic pi fraction for x [br, tr].forEach(pt => { board.create('text', [ () => {#float_aa#} + 0.15, () => pt.Y() + 0.15, () => `(${#ee*Ï€#}$, ${Math.round(pt.Y())})`.replace(/\$/g, '') ], {fontSize: 12, fixed: true, highlight: false}); }); [[/jsxgraph]]

We have

\(\displaystyle I=\displaystyle\int_{0}^{@aa@} \displaystyle \int_{0}^{@bb@} y\cos(x)\, \mathrm{d}y \mathrm{d}x \)

Which we can rewrite as

\(\displaystyle I=\displaystyle\int_{0}^{@aa@} \cos(x)\, \mathrm{d}x \times \displaystyle \int_{0}^{@bb@} y\, \mathrm{d}y \)

Evaluating, we get

\(\begin{align} I &= \left[\sin(x)\right]_{0}^{@aa@} \times \left[\dfrac{y^2}{2}\right]_{0}^{@bb@} \\ &= \left(\sin\left({@aa@}\right) - 0\right) \times \left(\dfrac{{@bb@}^2}{2} - 0\right) \\ &= {@sin(aa)*(bb)^2/2@} \end{align}\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

qtest.description: Test case assuming the teacher's input gets full marks.
